captions.text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Fall is officially here, leaves are changing,
it’s getting a little

chilly out and I have personally been drinking
a lot of tea lately.

So, I thought it would be a lot of fun to
share a tea recipe with you guys.

Today we are gonna be making Twitter Tea Biscuits,
let’s get started!

I’m so excited because today we are gonna
be making a traditional English Tea

Biscuit recipe, I’ve never made one of these
before so, I am JACKED!

The things that we’ll need for this recipe,
will be: 3 and 1/4 cup of flour,

1 cup of finely grated sugar, 1 and 3/4 sticks
of butter, 1 egg.

You’ll also need for a equipment: A rolling
pin, a big mixing bowl, a cookie

sheet to bake them on, and a little bird cookie
cutter, I found this one

online, so I’ll put a link down below. So
if you’re interested in getting
this one it’ll be right there.

For decorations we’ve got royal blue dye,
and I used this to dye the biscuit

icing, it’s basically cookie icing on top,
and we’ve got some blue sugar sprinkles.

Last but not least, you’ll need a mixer,
I’m just gonna be using a hand mixer today.
Let’s put it all together!
Tweet tweet!

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
take your big mixing bowl, we’re gonna
cream together our butter and sugar.

So just add all your butter, all of your
sugar and we’re gonna mix it together
until the butter and sugar are light and fluffy.

Once you've creamed your butter and sugar together,
now we are gonna add the one egg
and then mix it up again 'til it’s evenly combined.

Now you’re gonna slowly mix in your flour,
I’m gonna be adding it in 1/3rds

Once your biscuit dough is all mixed up, you’re
gonna place it in a piece of cling

wrap and then we’re gonna wrap it up tight,
then we’re gonna place it
in the fridge for about 20 minutes to chill.

Once your dough has chilled in the fridge,
now we are gonna roll it out
and cut out some little Twitter birds.

So, we’re gonna take a little bit of flour,
sprinkle it on top of your surface,

put a little bit of flour on our rolling pin,
and now we’re
just gonna roll out the dough.

Then, take your little bird cookie cutter
and cut ‘em out.

Press them into the dough, give it a little
wiggle, then remove the excess dough.

For a little bit of detail, you don’t need
to do this, but I am.

You’re gonna take a sharp cutting knife
and I’m just cutting off his little tail,

just a little bit so it looks more like the
twitter logo.

Once you’ve got all your cookies on the
sheet you’re gonna take your sharp knife

once again and you’re gonna create a little
cut-out so that
the biscuit can sit on the cup.
Make a little line, make another one, and, cut the top.

And then, using a toothpick, just pop out
the center.

Then do this to the rest of your cookies and
put them back in the fridge for

about 10 minutes, then they’re ready to
bake!

They will bake at 350 degrees from anywhere
between 8-12 minutes so
keep your eye on ‘em.

Once your biscuits are done baking, make sure
they’ve had plenty of time to cool,
and then we are gonna decorate!

We are gonna take our blue cookie icing and
the 1st thing I’m gonna do is trace

an outline of the little bird all the way
around.

Once you’ve got your outline ready, now
we’re gonna fill it in.

Once you’ve completely frosted your biscuit,
you’re gonna take a little bit of the

sugar sprinkles, and put them on the top.
You can put a little or a lot,
whatever you like.
I make it rain! Make it rain! Make it rain!

Now that our Twitter Tea biscuits are all
ready, we need to make some tea!

There are many options when it comes to tea,
you can have ones that are

already made, in the pack like this. They
have ginger tea, green tea, sleepy

time tea, lemon tea, anything that you’d
fancy, they’ve got so many flavors!

But today, I thought it would be fitting,
I went to Teavana and I got

some English Tea which is a Black Tea, and
I thought it would just be perfect,
English Breakfast Tea with English Biscuits!
Yum, yum, yum, yum, a perfect fit!

To make loose leaf tea you’re gonna need
an infuser. And, my sister got me this

infuser, it is the Death Star haha. It is
shaped just like the Death Star and
then the little end is the little Tie Fighter.
Pew-pew! Pew-pew!
That’s no moon! Huuuuhhh! It’s a tea infuser!

Got a little spoon here, and I’m just gonna
spoon a few scoops into my infuser.

Now you’re gonna take your tea infuser and
you’re gonna dip it into freshly

boiled water, let it sink down there, and
you’re gonna let it steep
for about 10 minutes.

And while it’s doing that, I always like
to add a little bit of lemon when I’m

having Black Tea, so I like to cut them in
half, and then in half again
and then half again.
Meep-meep-meep-meep-meep!

When your tea is as dark as you’d like,
take out your infuser, and I’m gonna
add a little bit of lemon!

And now you can take your little side of the
cup cookie, and
put him right on ‘dere!
Ta-da!
Here are our Twitter Tea Biscuits!

These were so much fun to make! I hope you
guys liked ‘em!

This smells so good, I can’t wait to drink
the tea and nom on these biscuits!
Om-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!

And, I made plenty of extras, so I might have
some friends over
for a tea party or something, I don’t know.

If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know!

Leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

Also, you can follow me on Twitter or Instagram
or Tumblr or Facebook,

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of our
baking creations today.

And if you guys make these, please tweet me
your pictures! I will retweet them
and post them, and re-blog them.

I just get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations! It just makes me happy!
Alright, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!

I, I love you like a biscuit baby, and I keep
hitting…
Re-Tweet-Tweet-Tweet-Tweet-Tweet!

title: HOW TO MAKE TWITTER TEA - NERDY NUMMIES
